title: 112_hr6174
content: The Act titled "Common Sense Nutrition Disclosure Act of 2012" amends disclosure requirements for restaurants, retail food establishments, and vending machines. The Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act is amended to include new requirements for calorie disclosure in menu items. The Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act is amended to include new requirements for calorie disclosure in menu items, including details on calories per serving and remote-access options for off-premises orders. The Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act is amended to include new requirements for calorie disclosure in menu items, including remote-access options for off-premises orders. The subclause defines a reasonable basis for nutrient disclosure. The term 'reasonable basis' for nutrient disclosure ensures that the information is within acceptable variations for nutrient content, including serving size, formulation errors, and ingredient differences. The term 'reasonable basis' for nutrient disclosure ensures accurate information for multi-serving items with different flavors or varieties in restaurants or retail food establishments. In subclause (xi), definitions for "menu" and "preset standard build" are clarified. The term 'restaurant or similar retail food establishment' is defined as a retail food establishment that generates over 50% of its revenue from selling specific types of food.
